pullRequest.title: Adding indexing pressure stats to node stats API
pullRequest.bodyText:
We have recently added internal metrics to monitor the amount of
indexing occurring on a node. These metrics introduce back pressure to
indexing when memory utilization is too high. This commit exposes these
stats through the node stats API.

nodes.bodyText: I think it would also be nice to unit test this class, by adding a non-public constructor that takes primaryAndCoordinatingLimits as input. We can then have unit tests that check the accounting and breaking behavior.

nodes.bodyText: Is this still relevant? What total do you mean here?
should we have another total_bytes field here that sums total_primary_and_coordinating_bytes and total_replica_bytes?
should we now also put this under indexing_pressure namespace, e.g. indexing_limits.memory.limit?

+        Setting.memorySizeSetting("indexing_limits.memory.limit", "10%", Setting.Property.NodeScope);

nodes.bodyText: You've suggested in Slack doing different buckets (coordinating vs. primary) in metrics, which I think is a good idea, as it will make it clearer that some nodes might only be doing coordination, while others might not be client-facing and therefore doing purely primary (+ replica) work.
